By James Bithell

This week, Food and Drink Editor Hana makes a winter-warming stew. (Thumbnail credit Philippa Grafton: all images)

The Twelve Days of Sobriety

By James Bithell

What to do with all that leftover festive booze? We've come up with recipes that'll use it up for the twelve days after Christmas

The Christmas Meal Timetable

It's a logistical nightmare. But Nouse is here to help.

The Review: The Loop Bar & Grill

A joke becomes obvious on arrival: this place isn't in the loop

The experiment - Panettone

Panettone is the most elegant take on the Christmas sweet...

Bonfire Night

Hallowe'en is past, but you've still got bonfire and Fireworks nights to come, so tuck into Hannah Clugston's festive recipes to celebrate

Lansley's health reforms mean nothing

Lansley certainly needs to consider the issue with a little more creativity and realism, if he wants to make any improvement whatsoever on the health of our nation (Thumbnail credit Andrew Lansley meets Birmingham nurses to discuss obesity issues. Image: University Hospitals Birmingham via Flickr)

Freshers: Where to eat in York

A Freshers guide of where to eat in York

Hungry? A blitzed kitchen guide

Here is the basic kitchen cupboard to help you get started with cooking at University. It's not supposed to be a Marmite selection (foods you love or hate), just a stock pile of simple ingredients that you'll use everyday for most dishes (Thumbnail credit Your typical student kitchen...)

Edinburgh Fringe '11: Where to eat

By James Bithell

Whether you're performing or watching, the Fringe is a big one, and cafes will feel like a godsend in between shows. Mia de Graaf gives you her pick of pizza places, chocolate soup cafes, and hog roast rolls in Edinburgh this year (Thumbnail credit A Kilimanjaro coffee. Image: alixanaeuphoria via Flickr)

Tropical tasting

Emily Prideaux tries out some not-so-normal smoothie flavours

Indochine

Yorkshire, oriental and tapas are not three words that go comfortably together. With the Yorkshire stereotype tending towards a mean old man with a whippet, a flat cap, and questionable dentistry, my first thought was of miniscule portions

Pesto Chicken

This baked dish is simple and colourful. It uses 'mini fillet breasts' but you can use normal sized ones and cut them into 2 inch goujons

El Piano

Being a vegetarian in a meat-eating world is tough, but thankfully there are quaint little restaurants that cater to everyone's needs - carnivores included. El Piano, just in the centre of York is one such place

Pub: Three Legged Mare

As I sat in the <strong>Three Legged Mare</strong>, my friends around me, listening to a pianist play a Lady Gaga medley it struck me that there is a fatal flaw to pub reviews...

Fish Pie

You can easily prepare it beforehand, and then lob it in the oven to cook - it's worth it, it tastes so much better than microwavable ones! Two boxes give you a substantial amount of filling for your pie

Fake it or bake it?

<em>Sophie Foot</em> gives her take on the cupcake fever that is whetting everyone's appetite

Mumbai Lounge

If you're feeling that maybe the UK went a bit overboard on the Britishness and the bunting with the recent royal wedding, and you remember that it wasn't so long ago that chicken tikka masala was Britain's favourite dish, then an outing to Mumbai Lounge might be in order (Thumbnail credit Photo: Lucy Dixon)

Pub: Ye Olde Starre Inne

Being old can often be a good thing. You gain respect, power and importance and people begin to look on you fondly. Think of the way the press seem to love Bruce Forsythe despite the fact that he is incredibly annoying (Thumbnail credit Photo: Olivia Waring)

Lentil & Aubergine Curry

This is so easy. Really tasty and can last you for ages - it freezes really well. This recipe probably gives you about four portions, though watch out for stray housemates who may claim it for themselves...

Peaches and Cream Cupcakes

Peaches and Cream Cupcakes - makes 12

Is that pucker or what?

Bored of baked beans? Will Wade tests whether it's really possible to rustle up Jamie's latest wonders in the promised 30 minutes.

Pub: Brigantes

A slight break from the traditional here as the pub review looks at a "bar and brasserie". In my defence <strong>Brigantes</strong> is able to offer one of the best selection of ales in York and as such qualifies

The Lime House

A small, quiet place on Goodramgate, The Lime House is a bit of a hidden gem. Or so I'd heard. It turns out, to its credit, it's rather less of an adventurous oddity and more of an unpretentious brasserie than previous visitors had suggested

Hunting for Heslington's Hotspot

Charles or Deramore? Finding an alternative to campus bars is no simple matter. Will Wade weighs up the pros and cons (Thumbnail credit Photo: Lucy Dixon)

La Tasca

La Tasca styles itself with the catchphrase 'Spain is closer than you think'. Being an enthusiast for Spanish cuisine, I looked forward to testing this theory (Thumbnail credit Photo: Justyn Hardcastle)

Pub: The Tam O' Shanter

Being a pub reviewer is pretty fun, as jobs go. You don't have to do much work and even when you do, the most taxing it gets when you just have to drain that last pint. Having said that since I've been touring the pubs I've been waiting to give a scathing review, to channel my inner A. A. Gill but, alas, in York, it's just not possible (Thumbnail credit Photo: Jason Lozier)

Caffeine, Cafes and Corporate Chains

As tea, coffee and cakes brim over into the narrow streets of York, Will Wade assesses the traditional tea room against the corporate names to which we are so accustomed (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Lucy Dixon)

Il Paradiso del Cibo

Eating at Il Paradiso is similar to eating in someone's front room. The tables are crammed together and there is a large television on the wall playing Italian football and music channels (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Justyn Hardcastle)

Pub

Described by my housemate who hails from Huddersfield as a "pub pub" (apparently this means it's a real pub) <strong>The Phoenix</strong> is another hugely enjoyable York pub (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Peter Iveson)

By James Bithell
